title: Britain’s economic recovery nearly stalled in July as Delta variant spread.
summary: The economy grew a mere 0.1 percent in July as businesses were also hampered by shortages of goods and staff, which pushed up prices.

title: Stocks decline for a second week as September’s slow retreat continues.
summary: Wall Street seems to be in a funk, with the S&P 500 declining about 2.3 percent since its latest high.

title: Global Markets Swoon as Worries Mount Over Superpowers’ Plans
summary: The S&P 500 closed down 1.7 percent over a number of jitters, like China’s sputtering real estate market and the phasing out of stimulus measures in the United States.

title: Royal Dutch Shell Sells Permian Basin Oil Holdings for $9.5 Billion
summary: The deal with ConocoPhillips comes with oil prices high, Permian production strong and Shell under pressure to move faster to cut carbon emissions.

title: Uneven Global Vaccination Threatens Economic Rebound, O.E.C.D. Warns
summary: The group forecast that the worldwide economy would grow 5.7 percent in 2021, slightly lower than its previous estimate.

title: A low-carbon economy is cheaper than the costs of climate change, a report says.
summary: The European Central Bank put the region’s economy under a microscope to assess the impact of climate change action and inaction.

title: Scotland’s Oil Industry Is Fading as Wind Energy Beckons
summary: Oil and gas production in the North Sea is not the economic juggernaut it once was. Can floating wind turbines offer an alternative?

title: Yellen Warns of ‘Catastrophic’ Consequences From Debt Limit Breach
summary: The Treasury secretary, testifying alongside Jerome H. Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, implored Congress to raise or suspend the nation’s borrowing cap before an Oct. 18 deadline.

title: Oil prices near a three-year high as an energy crunch looms.
summary: Analysts say soaring natural gas prices are helping push oil futures higher, as Brent crude briefly topped $80 a barrel.

title: Stocks tumble in worst day since May, as tech shares slide and bond yields climb.
summary: Investors, weighing the prospect of the Federal Reserve preparing to reduce its purchases of government debt, sold off bonds, pushing the 10-year’s yield to its highest level since June.

title: Stocks fall, swelling September’s losses.
summary: The S&P 500 ended the month down 4.8 percent.

title: Inflation Warning Signs Flash Red, Posing Challenge for Washington
summary: Inflation, once expected to fade quickly, is proving more stubborn. That ramps up tension among officials as they wait for pressures to fade.

title: Global Natural Gas Crunch Roils Consumers and Industry
summary: Rising demand for the fuel is sending electricity bills soaring and forcing factories to shut down.

title: Oil prices hit a seven-year high as OPEC and its allies stick with a modest increase.
summary: OPEC Plus signed off on increasing production by 400,000 barrels a day next month, under a deal reached in July.

title: Stocks drop again as Big Tech tumbles.
summary: Oil prices rose as OPEC met.

title: Energy Prices Spike as Producers Worry Over Pandemic and Climate
summary: Even as more costly fuel poses political risks for President Biden, oil companies and OPEC are not eager to produce more because they worry prices will drop.

title: Wall Street extends its rally as the Senate reaches a deal on raising the debt ceiling.
summary: Stocks started their move higher on Wednesday after Republicans offered a short-term compromise to avoid the U.S. defaulting on its debts.

title: Are Tesla and Texas a Perfect Match? It’s Questionable.
summary: While its C.E.O., Elon Musk, and the state’s conservative lawmakers share libertarian sensibilities, they differ greatly on climate change and renewable energy.

title: Lebanon Gets New Prime Minister Amid Economic Meltdown
summary: The billionaire Najib Mikati’s new cabinet is Lebanon’s first empowered government in more than a year. It faces the immediate challenge of a collapsing economy.

title: Norway’s ‘Climate Election’ Puts Center-Left in Charge
summary: Global warming and the future of the country’s oil and gas industry dominated the election campaign, yet smaller parties with ambitious approaches on climate fared less well than expected.

title: With Fuel from Iran, Hezbollah Steps In Where Lebanon Has Failed
summary: The militant group trucked more than 1 million gallons of diesel into Lebanon, flouting U.S. sanctions and billing itself as savior to a suffering population.

title: Trudeau Wins, but Is Diminished by a Futile Election
summary: The prime minister struggled to find a campaign issue that could distinguish his party and expand its power in Parliament.

title: In Britain, Rising Prices and Shortages Evoke 1970s-Style Jitters
summary: The nation’s economy is very different from the bleak days of the 70s, but certain parallels are unnerving Britons and loom as a potential headache for Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

title: Britain’s Gas Crisis, Explained
summary: A shortage of truck drivers has led to empty fuel pumps around the country, creating long lines at gas stations and panic buying.

title: The U.K.’s Gas Crisis Is a Brexit Crisis, Too
summary: Until now, the government has blamed Covid-related restrictions for a spate of shortages. But as virus restrictions ease and fuel runs short, the focus is shifting to Britain’s exit from the E.U.

title: Britain’s Christmas Lament: Meat Shortages and Delivery Delays
summary: Military personnel are driving transport trucks. Pig farmers may start culling their stock. Even the government says shortages will affect Christmas, as Britons brace for a challenging winter.

title: A Tech-Savvy Holocaust Memorial in Ukraine Draws Critics and Crowds
summary: Traditionalists chafe at the contemporary-art approach to Holocaust commemoration being employed at Babyn Yar, a site of mass shootings in World War II. But it has brought visitors for an anniversary.

title: As Europe Faces a Cold Winter, Putin Seizes on the Leverage From Russia’s Gas Output
summary: Critics claim Russia is manipulating the flow of gas to push up prices, but for Vladimir Putin it’s schadenfreude over Western European nations that he sees as unprepared.

title: Electricity Is Restored in Lebanon, as Army Supplies Emergency Fuel
summary: It was a temporary reprieve for a grid that has been supplying only a few hours of electricity per day, as Lebanon’s collapsing economy struggles to import fuel.
